prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: Hi I am feeling blue, things aren't going well at all

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: Hello, hello. I am so sorry to hear. Can I ask you more about it?

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: my girlfriend and I split after 4 years!

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content:
Oh no
!!!

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: I am sorry, how do you feel? sad? joyful?

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: Ver sad and lonely.  I loved her

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: Very*

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: What should I do?

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: oh no. I can totally understand that feeling. 4 years is a long time.

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: Thanks it is.  She said I was neglecting her and we had a big fight.  haven't talked to her in a month

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: I would recommend doing your own thing, for example, devote into your hobby or do some other jobs.

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: Do you think drinking alcohol will help?

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: Ohhhh. well. I never ditch my partner, always my partner ditch me, so I do not know why they do that.

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: I think it will worsen.

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: You had a similar experience?

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: I want to drink till I forget about her.

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: yes, I quit alcohol 3 years ago. it took me 20 years

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: How did you do it?

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: It took me 1 whole year to forget about my ex

samples.label: V5

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: What suggestions do you have for unruly kids who argue when their parent need quiet in their respective offices because we work at home?

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: Yelling does not work.

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: Have you tried to talk to your kids about that?

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: I'm thinking of taking away devices, but then Corona is still here. I feel that is very mean considering they are already stressed being in doors.

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: Talking is great when we are doing it and they all agree. But it never stays this way.

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: Maybe that will be a good thing because it might make them wished they had listened to you and won't do it again,

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: I almost feel like crying.

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: I hear you but....

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: Everything will be okay

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: Try to talk to them and be very firm with them

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: I feel that is abusive when I know how bad they are being affected psychologically. I actually feel like just locking them in their rooms until we get done working. Kind of like being grounded....

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: I will try to talk with them again. I know I will probably be tearful which I know bothers them.

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: How about reward them with something if they listen and behave

samples.label: V5

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: I can sympathise with you having siblings with extreme mental health problems - I have been there too and I know how difficult it is.

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: I tried to have  my mother take her back, but she still didnt want her there. So I sent her to my grandmothers and she turned that side of the family against me.

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: Mentally ill people can unfortunately sometimes be manipulative, though they do not mean it. Have you had any contact with her since?

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: Only once and she was just telling me that I was a horrible person.

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: This all started over her stopping her meds and then I asked her to clean her room.

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: That sounds very toxic. Is it possible to persuade her to seek medical help? I realise she might be reluctant to

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: We have tried to get her into therapy again. But, COVID put a block on that.

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: I suggested that she go back to the ward and maybe be placed into a group home.

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: Ah yes, it is a terrible time at the moment isn't it? I think a lot of people are not getting the medical help that they need because of the virus

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: Please do not beat yourself up over this - it does sound as though you have done absolutely everything you could to help.

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: I would hate to see that happen, but Im at my wits end.

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: I can tell that you feel really bad about this just from your  tone of voice. Please remember that you can't fix everything in the world.

samples.label: V5

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: Jobs are super competitive these days. Have you thought about becoming a YouTuber or a live streamer?

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content:
Yes, I've tried both of those. It's mostly luck based. You just have to hope that enough people get interested to make it work and a lot of wasted effort goes into self-
promotion.

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: I believe after Covid is over more onsite jobs will be available. I hope you will be able to comfortably spend your days until then.

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: I agree with that. I just hope

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content:
* 
I can make it until then

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: Oh I see. I see you have made a lot of effort to get additional income. Wonderful, I believe you are a great worker when you work, whatever you do. You have passion and motivation.

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: That is true, I am a hard worker, no matter the job.

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: I would brush up my resume, make it more noticeable, change your LinkedIn profile if you have one. So that future employer will be able to find you, such a great candidate.

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: Hmmm, my resume could use some work, that is true.

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: About resume, one of my friends added his picture wearing a Trump tie on his resume  lol . I thought it was weird but whatever it makes it noticeable could help.

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: Or you could start your own business as you have already tried as a YouTuber. I heard a lot of people starts their own because of Covid

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content:
I never thought about adding a picture to my resume, but it would help show that I'm a profes
sional.

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: I have ran my own business, doing custom woodworking for people. For now, I'd rather work for other people. Plus the whole being broke thing really restricts what I could do for a new business.

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: Me either, I had never seen a resume with a picture. Yes wear a nice suit and look good.

samples.label: V5

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: hey

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: How are you friend?

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: Not so good

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: why?

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter

prefix_conversation.content: don't worry..

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: ok, i did understand..

samples.label: V5

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: he just didn't like doing things sometimes

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: but generally is fine.

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: It sounds like you feel he has a loss of motivation towards school work, is this correct?

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: no, he just didn't want to be told what to do.

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: very emotional these days for kids

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: Alright, so you feel he has an issue with following instructions? Have you ever tried disciplinary action like taking away video games when he feels he does not want to listen to you?

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: Yes I did.  But no point, he just upset on things like didn't get to be with his friends, or having no friends, no life etc.

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: Do you feel he could possibly be depressed?

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: I think so

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: But so am I .

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: It must be even harder during times of the virus!

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: Yes

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: I am sorry to hear that, have you thought about seeing a counselor through the internet?

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: yes may be i have to reach out for his school counseler

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: thanks for listening .

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: I think that is a very nice idea. I also might suggest finding activities that you both could enjoy and spend time together. Maybe finding a show you both could enjoy will open up room for a greater connection!

samples.label: V5

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: I would certainly agree with you. That kind of work is unsustainable. Let me ask you this. What would happen if you told your employer you simply could not do these hours?

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: hah - i dunno. im on a team of 2 people - and i guess if i dont do it, the other person has to. or it just doesnt get done, and i dont know what happens?? nothing? LOL.

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: The worst that could happen is that they fire you. But that doesn't seem too likely as they seem to need you. But I have learned in life that if I don't care for myself, hardly anyone does. We need to be kind to ourselves. Set boundaries.

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: agreed - i dont think they would fire me, maybe get reprimanded or more likely a guilt trip as to why I cant do it. Im just not sure what kind of boundaries I set when we have things due, and just literally no time.

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: Setting boundaries can be difficult if you haven't done that a lot. When we think we don't have the ability to say NO, then we feel trapped, worn out, depressed, taken advantage of. People need to know that we reasonably can say no.

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: Well, I have to set boundaries, because working till 11pm most nights is not sustainable. and who on earth is going to view, let alone sign a contract at 12am

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: I think that would be the first step. Determine how many hours you feel you COULD work. Then advise them that is what you will do. Find out what kind of timelines there are, and if you can't do it, don't go beyond your boundaries. It is obviously destroying your life. It really isn't healthy for you.

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: Exactly. It isn't working for you. Something has to change. And you sound intelligent, so you can determine what will work for you -- perhaps a range of hours, but definitely not 14 hours. Unless you are a young kid. lol Even then, that's a lot.

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: yeah - ill come up with reasonable boundaries till 5:30 is reasonable, and if its a do or die situation cap it at 7:30 --- and thats only for dire situations. if that doesnt work, well then i guess either i dont have a job, or people figure out how to work in regular hours.

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: That sounds reasonable to me. And if they try to make you feel guilty, reject that. Tell them, I'm sorry, but I feel this is reasonable, and truly it is.

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: hah i used to go out like a young kid, but still - just because most of us are working from home 24/7, doesnt mean I actually can work 24/7. even fi i were young, hell no. they dont pay me enough.

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: thanks i really appreciate it. it sounds reasonable, and its what a coworker told me. if i dont set boundaries, i will crack.

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: No one can work 24/7.  I think they may not even be aware you are struggling. So communication is important.

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: You don't want to crack. It's not worth it.

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: yeah, i think a call to not just my boss is in order, but also HR to advise them of the situation. they need to start telling managers, we are NOT front of the line workers, nor police, fire, etc. our jobs are not THAT important.

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: I will say a prayer that you communicate your needs politely but firmly. And not believe false guilt. As you said, you aren't putting out fires and doing CPR.

samples.label: V5

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: Talking to someone you are close to, like a family member who cares about you, can definitely help.

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: Can you try talking to someone?

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: Family? My family kicked me out of their own house 3 years ago. I am nothing but a burden for them. They would just appreciate if I died.

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: What about close friends, or people you care about? I am sure they would not want to lose you.

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: I have NO ONE that cares about me. Not a single being.

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: Are overdoses painful?

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: I care

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: I doubt you do. You are just getting paid to be here.

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: Just from chatting with you, I can feel how sad you are about life and maybe a little overwhelmed with what the next step of life is.

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: What would be that next step if I asked you?

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: I used to be really sad about life too. However, helping others who are sad helped me become happier, knowing that I am helping others also become happier.

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: What makes you think someone as useless as me could provide any help?

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: Take a deep breathe and think about any happy memories. If you are sad right now, the only way is up from here!

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: I believe no one is useless. We were all brought on this earth for a reason.

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: That's a very optimistic view...

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: Like I said, I used to be sad too and not optimistic. But now I am optimistic because I know what it is like to be sad, and I don't want others to feel how I have felt in the past.

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: I guess that's a way to view it...

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: Have you tried to express your feelings in one way or another? If you don't want to talk to others, there is always other ways - such as writing, music, etc. Have you tried any different ways?

samples.label: V5

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: What did it do for you?

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: How so?

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: It was good to be able to talk to an objective third party about what was going on. It allowed me to get my feelings out without the threat of being judges or harrassed.

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: I understand. Well, I appreciate your time and advice. I just don't feel like you and I are understanding each other very well, though. Anyway, you made your bonus. I appreciate you trying to help me, though

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: We got to talk for another 4 minutes though

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: Have you tried to focus on more of your hobbies in order to get your mind off of things?

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: I used to have more hobbies. Now, I'm not so motivated to do much of anything anymore.

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: I used to play instruments. I like hiking a little, but it is winter now. So... I can't even do that. Plus... I have to travel really far to do that because there is nothing to hike that is very close

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: Why did you stop playing insturments?

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: I just lost interest. I'm losing interest in everything, man

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: I think it's time for my heart to give out and make space for the new, ya know

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: Cross my fingers at least

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: Dying in your sleep would be best

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: Wouldn't that be nice? You just drift off after your heart stops in a dream?

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: I certainly hope you don't do that!

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: Well, that's nice. You are a nice person.

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: Anyway, You finally earned your 3 dollars and 50 cents. You tried. I appreciate it.

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: Goodbye fellow mturker slave

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: I apologize that I wasn't able to make you feel any better

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: What got you depressed?

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: Don't let it take control of you that is what it is trying to do

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: I suffer from depression once in a while and what i do is to try my best to remain positive and let myself know it is going to be okay i will get through this

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: I am trying it but not working on me. I feel like my life is no use

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: You should never feel like your life is no use because it is you have a lot to live for

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: you have to control those negative thoughts and replace them with positive thoughts i know it is hard but believe me you will feel better

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: am not feeling so good, being depressed feeling like killing myself, i don't know after all have done for her

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: OK. This is a temporary feeling and it will pass. Please be kind to yourself.

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: What led to you feeling this way?

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: i proposed to my girl after 5 years of dating, she introduced me to one man claiming its her uncle, was very happy i had to meet one of my fiancé family not knowing all was but lies

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: she took me to go see the man, the man even gave us relationship advice

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: OK. So you proposed to your girlfriend, but she was seeing another man?

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: yes!! seeing the so called man she called her uncle

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: And the man you thought was her uncle was her other boyfriend?

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: That is a horrible situation. It's not nice when people lie to you - I've had it happen to me before.

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: You must be feeling very betrayed at the moment.

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: caught them in the act, was devastated, my body was shaking, couldn't bear my eyes

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: its was as if my heart was being ripped outta my soul

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: That sounds horrible. I think anyone would be upset with that!

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: I wonder if it was best that this happened before you got married, though - it hurts, but it would have hurt more if she had become your wife. How does it feel if you think about it that way?

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: All i could do at that moment is pretend i didn't see a thing

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: yh! am happy i knew sooner

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: How does your family and friends feel about it? Have you spoken to them?

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: but it s painful, i rented an apartment for her, was the one sponsoring her and her brother

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: You must feel as though she has taken advantage of you and your generosity.

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: i will pray them.you don't feel any thing

samples.label: V5

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: Good evening.

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: Hello. How's it going?

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: It's going well, how are you?

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: I'm somewhat anxious and distressed because of college.

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: Is there anything specific going on in school that it making you anxious?

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: Yes, I have a large project I must complete for one class, a very important exam for another, and for another my professor is quite incompetent and might cause me to fail that course.

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: Okay, so from what I have read you are anxious because you have a project and an exam going on and you are struggling in another, is that correct?

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: Yes, that is correct. It's caused severe anxiety for me.

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: I can tell just from these few messages how anxious you are about these things.

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: I am currently in college too, and I completely understand the anxiety around your project and your exams.

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: Yes, it's very unfortunate that things turned out this way. I might have the project and exam dealt with, but the one with the incompetent professor makes me want to slam my head on the wall.

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: Have you talked to the professor in the class you are struggling in about ways he can help you learn better? I have found that speaking with my professors when I was struggling and explaining why has helped me in the past.

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: Yes, I have talked with him. Unfortunately, communication is the worst part with him. He will read emails but only selectively respond to some things. I ask him to give me the details for an assignment he never sent the details for and he always ignores it.

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content:
I do
n't think he even has the assignment instructions recorded anywhere.

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: Is there anyone in your class that you are close to that you can reach out to?

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: We have a Discord server set up for the class where we're all trying to make sense of the class and our professor because it has been such a bad experience for all of us.

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: Unfortunately even that doesn't help.

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: Have you thought about reaching out to a tutor who has previously taken this course to help with the assignments?

samples.label: V5

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: that is a very good idea

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: maybe it is time to include her manager

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: I feel for you because I've been there and I completely understand how you feel.  And yes including HER and her manager won't make her feel as though you're going behind her back.

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: the other thing that has become an issue is her ridiculing me in front of others

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: there have been a number of incidents in which she has singled me out, and it has left me feeling disrespected

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: ridiculing you how?  that's never ok

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: you have every right to feel upset about that.

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: i have reached out to HR regarding these incidents but they seem to be uninterested

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: i no longer want to come to work but i don't have a choice

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: I wonder why HR isn't interested.  Have you put it in writing?  No one likes a paper trail that isn't acknowledged.

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: i was vague with my initial contact to HR

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: that has to be a horrible feeling to be in such a hostile work environment.  do you have coworkers who would be willing to back you up?

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: there's definitely power in numbers!

samples.label: V5

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: Exactly

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: From the few messages we have exchanged, I can tell you are extremely upset by this,

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: Yes i am. This is one of those days that I think about it and make me up set

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: I myself have had issues with feeling like I haven't been able to give back to my parents what they have given me, it is a really hard situation to be in,

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: It is because it makes you feel bad and you start being negative

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: Those are completely normal feelings to have, but I know you can get through this!

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: I do, Im trying to keep my head up and think positively. I know some day God will give me that little push I need to give my family the happiness they deserve

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: Have you been able to talk to your parents about this? I think that it would help you to tell them what you are feeling.

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: I talk to them sometimes about this they cheer me up and they know that I would give them everything if I could.

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: Have you reached out and tried to talk to a professional about this as well? I know when I was struggling with anxiety and depression I went to counseling and it helped me a lot.

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: To be honest I haven't try it. I thought about it but I haven't try. But I should keep that in mind

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: I think that would be a great start and I know it would make you feel better!

samples.label: V5

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: Does CSR stand for Customer Service Representative?

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: yes sorry it does I also have some banking under my belt but have been out of work for couple years because I was caring for my father

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: he needed 24/7 my moms not as bad but needs help

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: Well, CSR and experience in Banking must mean you have some skills that are in high-demand. Many companies need CSR's, and Banks are always hiring. Skills needed for CSR are very translatable to other customer service jobs, sales, and more!

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: yes I know if I could find something where I could work from home thats would help but sometimes I just feel like giving up and going back to bed

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: I'm sure you will find something very quickly.

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: thank you I hope so it helps to just talk about it

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: also, many companies have shifted their workforce to work from home, so you are even more likely to get a service position in a work-from-home environment,

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: I have been looking but till after the move things have been all out of wack

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: I see, so it sounds like you need a job search tool that will save you time.  I'd recommend putting your profile on LinkedIn, and/or checking a job aggregator like Indeed or Glassdoor. There, you can view and apply for several jobs.  I recommend applying and interviewing for several positions at the same time to improve your odds. I'm sure you will get one.

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: yes I have o some of those thanks I will just have to cross my fingers

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: Glad to hear. Sounds like your are doing all the right things.

samples.label: V5

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: I would feel the same way if that's a house I grew up in. I'm so sorry!

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: i tried to talk to him, in his mind its all my fault he cant pay the bills he had before i moved in. i had been living in california for the last few years, but came back with corona virus on the rise there.

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: If he's in a certain mindset, it would be hard to change that.

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: Do you have people to talk to about this? It sounds like a lot to handle.

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: right? and his fiancé is the same way, they are both alcoholics and spend most  of their income on their habits. its all i can do right now to keep food in the house, let alone running water.

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: I think it would be good for you to talk to someone and get help.

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: Right now, all you can do is keep chugging along and trying your best to stay afloat.

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: i have a couple of friends that i have talked to about it, but it just seems like i am screaming at a brick wall and nothing changes.

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: I would suggest talking to a therapist if your insurance can handle that!

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: Talking with them can help you figure out what you should do.

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: honestly, i think its him that needs the therapist. he is clearly bi polar like my father was, and dosent want to admit to it. several people have tried to talk to him about it but he just denies it and goes to the other room. i know what a the therapist will tell me, that i need to either resolve the conflict or try and move out, hard to do with the epidemic going on and a lack of funds to do it.

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: is it normal to always feel helpless? cause thats how its been. either rip everything to shreds or do nothing.

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: Yes it is. Especially now. I just want to encourage to keep pushing. Think about yourself in a year or two from now. Do everything you can right now to get out of the situation. If it gets really bad, don't be afraid to call out for help (like the police). Stay safe and do what's best for you.

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: You've got this!

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: police are a very bad idea where i live. they will not prosecute family violence without also prosecuting me. i live in texas, if i press charges, the state will press charges against me. i have several scars from incidents where they told me as such. its really a loosing battle where the law is concerned here.

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: oh wow that's terrible. that must be so stressful for you

samples.label: V5

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: About two weeks. I have barely left the house since then. I just do not feel that I can go on.

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: not leaving the house is the new normal for many of us right now. are you not leaving because you have nowhere to go or because you are feeling bad

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: I think mostly the latter. I just do not want to face the world any more . I feel that everyone must know that I've been dumped and be laughing at me.

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: you havve already made it two weeks by going one day at a time

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: I did not really have any choice though .  I do not see any future for myself now that we are separated.

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: do you know brene brown and her work

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: No I do not, who is that?

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: she studies vuneraility and shame. please look for her TED talk and there's a great youtube video on empathy

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: Thank you , I will. Right now I really need some sort of emotional support. I feel that the last fifteen years of my life have been a waste.

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: i bring her up because what i sounds like is that you are feeling embarrassed because your partner made a choice that wasn't you

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: in reality the choice they made wasn't about you, it was about them

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: It is not so much that - it is that I feel that I dedicated the majority of my adult life to this relationship and now there is nothing left.

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: you are left and you are enough. even if you dont feel like it right now you are enough

samples.label: V5

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: What are you currently studying?

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: I am studying microbiology. I do not know that I have the passion for it that I once did though.

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: Your motivation and how you are studying is probably related, you are right. What attracted you to microbiology in the first place?

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: I have always found it fascinating and have an uncle who is a microbiologist. But these days I feel I made the wrong decision. Is it too late to change?

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: It is never too late to change anything. However, i hear that you have always found it fascinating,have you considered talking to your uncle and seeing if you can find what you loved about it again?

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: Yes that does sound like good advice. I do not want to turn by back on my studies of the past years. But my grades are really poor and I am not sure what to do about that.

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: Studying can be really difficult , especially when you are half way through. i struggled in my studies and found that talking to my tutors helped and approaching student support. Have you tried anything like that or has your motivation held you back?

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: To be honest I have been a little afraid to approach them about the subject because they might accuse me of just slacking. I know it might look like that from the outside.

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: Just from chatting to you, I can sense that you are anxious, however, as many students feel this way, they will have a whole lot of help they can provide.

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: I do feel that part of my problem is that I am afraid to really open up about it. You are the first person I have really felt able to talk to.

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: I am pleased that you have been able to open up to me, it is the first step towards you finding your path. Do you find it easy to write things down?

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: Yes, it is really much more easy to write my problems down than to actually talk to people about them face to face.

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: One suggestion is for you to write down all the reasons that you love microbiology. It can be any format, I love a bubble chart (mind map), it could be in list form or just doodles, would this be something you would find useful?

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: Yes, that is a fantastic idea! Maybe I can find a renewed interest in the subject. I hope that I can because I really do not want my time studying to have been wasted.

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: It would be a really good place to start. Then you could be really kind to yourself and take some pressure off. Would you like to talk through some ideas to help with the work itself?

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: Yes I really would. I already feel more motivated! Half an hour ago I felt that I had no place left to go and felt defeated.

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: That's really good, sometimes it is about finding a direction and small steps. Often when we are studying the work seems really big, especially essay questions. One thing that helped me was to break it into really small chunks, sometimes physically covering up some of the question. Would that be something that would help?

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: I have not really tried it but I ought to. I often feel that I am just overwhelmed. Then I know that I got something wrong for definite and I just want to give up.

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: It could be something you can try, remember , it is not always about ought to, simply how can I make it easier for myself. It is okay to get things wrong too. If you decide to write your list of reasons why you love microbiology, maybe you could keep it in a place you see every day, a mirror or fridge and keep seeing where you are trying to get to.

samples.label: V5

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: Wow, it's slightly uncanny the way our situations are similar. For someone who is also not in the best place financially and just making the bare minimum, it can feel hopeless sometimes.

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: I know you are feeling stressed at the moment, but I've realized focusing on the long term helps ease the pressure of current stressors.

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: I get to a point in my day where it feels like I've done everything I can for that day, and then I just have to try not to get too stir crazy.

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: I feel that if you can focus on using your extra time as an investment into yourself (whether by reading, picking up a hobby, or working out), you can feel more accomplished and at ease with what you are doing in life.

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: I've been trying to look ahead, but this year has already set me back so much from my intended career path that it's frustrating. I just want my life back.

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: That is good advice. I have been doing a lot more art during this time.

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: Being progressive is difficult, but is one of the things in life which compound very easily. I believe many aspects in life are connected and that improving in some parts improves you as a whole

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: Some days it's tempting to just do nothing and wait for it all to be over, but I feel better when I accomplish something for the day

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: And if these "improvements" can also make you money/increase your worth/ease your mind, then that can be called a success. In my opinion atleast.

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: I wish someone was interested in buying my art! That would be a huge confidence boost

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: Yeah, but imagine how it would if you had days like that knowing it isn't a bad thing to relax. You have already put in the work in being comfortable before, allowing to enjoy your time however way you wanted.

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: Looks like you already have an interest which can help you in many ways in life. That's really good.

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: yes, I miss being able to actually relax. When you are financially behind it feels like everything is just making it worse.

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: thank you for chatting with me and helping me earn the bonus for this task!

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: Yes, the tension and pressure only seems to mount on, but there will always be things like that in life. It is important to remember whether such problems are in your control or not. If they are, you know for sure that you can change how you are presently.

samples.label: V5

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: i'm struggling with my depression, I can't seem to get a handle on it

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: I'm really sorry to hear that.  What kinds of things have you been doing so far to manage your downswing?

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: I just keep reliving that moment in my head

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: Lots of obsessive, intrusive thoughts?

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: yes, they just keep popping up  can't stop it

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: When I get stuck in that loop, I try to change up my entire physical situation -- take a shower or a soak, change up my music if I'm listening to it.  Kind of force my brain to take in a change.

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: I tried, I tried to keep myself busy, but boom my depressions hits me like a brick wall.

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: Have you ever explored medication?  I was diagnosed with bipolar disorder almost two years ago, and medication has made an enormous difference for me.

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: no my doctor prescribed me meds but it's not working. I will try meditation see it works. any more ideas?

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: You should definitely see if the doctor can adjust your meds, I have ended up on a completely different type of medication than the one I tried first.  But I understand.  I think you should try getting out of the house and enjoying fresh air and physical activity.  It won't cure your depression but it may help your headspace and your point of view.

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: hate taking meds. just keep reliving that moment. can't get it out of my head. it's killing

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: Have you written it down?  Like physically written it down?  Sometimes when I have the obsessive thoughts, I'll do that and being able to see it "in real life" satisfies my brain.

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: But if you're reliving a traumatic moment, it may be beneficial to seek out a licensed therapist who can help you process and move past the moment.

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: I will take your advice and right down my thoughts , maybe it will help the pain

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: I have, I've been seeing a therapist. his not much help I think but it's someone I can talk too

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: I hope it helps you out, you don't deserve to feel constant pain.

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: thank you I hope so too

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: You seem motivated to get better, so I am confident you will be successful.  You deserve to feel wonderful.

samples.label: V5

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: I understand.  Sometimes it's hard to find joy.  When do you think you starting feeling this way?

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: Almost 2 years ago. I'm so lonely without her

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: Sometimes, finding joy can be difficult. Especially when what we always turned to for joy is gone.

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: But we can find comfort in little things.  Is there something you have that gives you comfort?  Even the smallest thing.

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: When she was alive I felt like she was keeping me alive because i didn't want to put her through the pain of killing myself

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: I feel good for a few minutes at a time but then it all seems pointless

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: I believe we all have purpose in this life.  I know that it's hard to live with-out the ones we hold dearly.  I think a way we can keep them alive in our hearts is to pass on the good things about they did for us to others.

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: You hit the nail on the head. I struggle to find purpose for my life. I have no kids & my anxiety keeps me from reaching out to people.

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: I feel the same way, I get anxious around others as well.

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: Maybe little steps are the best way.  Sometimes all someone needs is a smile, even when we can't find our own, we can give one to others.

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: Everytime I convince myself to seek professional help I fool myself into believing that this will finally be the time I will be able to fix myself. Of course I haven't yet

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: I admit it has helped to be online & see that so many other people share my "symptoms"

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: It's always hard to make that next step, but I believe you're closer than you think.

samples.label: V5

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: hi

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: How are you doing today?

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: not quite ok! my head keep ringing, breathing rate fast all i could think of was the occurrence

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: What's the occurrence exactly that you are referring to?

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: caught my girlfriend cheating on me

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: Oh wow! I'm so sorry! I can't imagine how you are feeling! Have you found anything to do to keep you busy? Or maybe some good distractions?

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: no! all i think of is her, loved her wish she never did that

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: Do you think you guys could reconcile your relationship? Is there any hope? Is she willing to work with you and work through her mistakes?

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: i wished we could, i just cannot get it of my mind

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: It takes time. Sometimes, the best relationships occur when people work through the most difficult occurrences in their relationship. Have you tried talking to her? I would recommend talking to her when your emotions have settled.

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: guessed you right, i just don't know if i can trust her, I don't think i can heal from the betrayer

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: I would make a pros and cons list. If there are a lot of pros, I think it's worth a shot! Just give yourself time to process everything that has happened. You don't want to sit down and talk to her and let all your emotions come out. That could cause more harm. Just make a list and you'll have a better understanding of which direction you should go with your relationship!

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: i understand, its just hard to trust when the trust is broken, hard to know what direction to turn to, forgive her or move on, to choose is just a hard decision. Guess i need to hear her own part of the story

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: Yes. Give it time. Wait to hear her story. Make your pros and cons list. And see where to go from there. Be easy on yourself. It's okay to have hard days. Just give yourself time to heal from the hurt!

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: I try working towards that, i just wish am back to myself soon because it has really affected me.

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: I am sure it has! Try to spend time with friends and family that can be there for you during this time. You need to lean on people when things get hard like this!

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: wished i have friends i could trust, all just mock and wished you worse, hated being alive

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: That's awful! You need better friends than that!! What about your family?

samples.label: V5

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: yes..and iam finding it difficult to cope with that..

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: That sounds very disappointing, I can understand why you are feeling down about this.   I had to stop university halfway through for health reasons, and was not able to go back, I found that depressing too.

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: How did you manage to get out of the depression..If you dont mind,can you tell me what happened?

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: it is hard to let go of a dream.  it's normal to feel down about it.

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: Can you suggest some remedies of how to get out of depression..

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: I have mental health issues so I could not continue my studies, sadly.   I take antidepressants and have a counselor.

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: is there anyone you can talk to about your depresion, perhaps your doctor?

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: Oh I cannot go to counsellor because of they are too expensive..

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: I want to talk about it to some one but even my parents are not very supportive of me..

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: Are you in a city?  Some cities have free counselors

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: oh dear that is hard when your family is not behind you

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: Yes iam in a city..I dont know about any free counsellors..How to find the info

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: are you near a public library?  sometimes librarians are really helpful to find community information.  you could call them.

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: do you have a family doctor?

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: Oh I think we have a public library near to my houe..I can enquire about it

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: or of course you could do a google search for counseling

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: sure..I can do that..thank you for your help..

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: it sounds like what you are going through is a grieving proces.  it's the loss of a dream that was very important to you.  it will get easier over time

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: I really hope so that i will be happy with my life..

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: i hope you can go back to academics in the future, do you think that will be possible?

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: Hmm do you mean literally or metaphorically?

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: Literally. She cannot hear. She was born deaf.

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: Well can you communicate with her through sign language?

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: I can, But I have no hands.

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: Gosh, life hasn't treated the pair of you very well, has it?

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: It sure hasn't. I was born with a huge nose And I have to slam my nose into the keys in order to type.

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: Well, at least you're putting it to good use.

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: I just want to tell my ex who cheated on me with her ex I still love her.

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: if I had hands she wouldn't of had to cheat.

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: But with only a huge nose to work with - is this really viable?

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: I want it to be. But It hurts my face to insant message her on AIM.

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: You still have AIM? Wow, you are really out of date. I hate to say it but maybe she's better off with her ex?

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: We met on AIM, Her ex is a registered sex offender. and it makes me sad that she left me for someone like that

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: Sometimes we just have to learn to let go *nods sententiously*

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: Yeah but, he's got hands and a small nose, right?

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: His hands are so big he could be a power forward in the WNBA

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: and average "15 Minutes' per game

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: I do not know what that is but I can probably spend the rest of my life without finding out and still die happy.

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: her ex is like John wall and I look like Justin beiber with no hands. He tried to fight me and told me if i talk to her again I'm gonna "Catch these hands"

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: I don't know who those people are either. I live a very sheltered life.

prefix_conversation.content: I'm still waking up, should have more coffee. And, I am just always tired, tired of everything these days

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: Yes , What happen why you are tired please can you explain

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: ok , everything going ok

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: I think it's my depression. I have a very hard time getting motivated to do anything. Nothing seems worth it

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: Please can you tell why you are in depression ?

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: I have suffered with it all my life, but this past year has made it so much worse. I feel as if I have no control over anything as these stupid lockdowns go on and on and on

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: Are you a real person?

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: please engaged yourself in different actives that help you come out from this depression

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: I know that I need to do that, but it's pushing myself that is so hard.

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: yes, everyone going in this situation because of lock down

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: For sure, and I know that so many are much worse off than I.

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: yes i know that's hard put please try to engaged yourself in fun activates

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: what do you do for fun? can you give me any ideas?

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: those activities that you like that you feel fun in it

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: here is also lock down situation from log time , how is there?

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: Why your in depression because of job or any thin else

samples.label: V5

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: If he makes that threat again, you might wish to inform him that "revenge porn" is a crime these days.  If he knows that you might to go to the authorities, that might get him to leave you alone.

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: thank you very for your care and concern , sure  I will reply him as you said.

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content:
You seem like a very nice person.  And his behavior is very toxic, to say the least.  
I know that things are hard right now, but things will get better.  
And you deserve to be with someone who will treat you with kindness and respect.

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: I lost my all saving and now I am jobless both make me mentally disturbed , I feel life meaningless and don't want to live in this world.

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content:
Try not to lose hope.  
It's hard out there, particularly with what the pandemic has done to the economy.   
But from what I've read today, more stimulus from the government is on the way, so that should help some.

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: Do you have anyone that you can talk to about what you're going through?

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: He had an affair but he spreading is fake news about me that I cheated him. I ashamed about myself and I can't able to mingle with my friends and family.

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content:
Don't let him make you feel ashamed.  You've done nothing to warrant such a feeling.  
Maybe you should find someone outside of your social group to speak to.

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: I can't able to face the all consequence all together, I need peace , where I could find?

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: There are places you can go to speak to people.  Charitable organizations, clergy if you are religious, and call centers.  Perhaps you could find one of those organizations locally to help you through this.  Also, since they would be local, they might have more information about legal remedies you could pursue.  Some of your ex's behavior sounds criminal...

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: People like you and your words touched my soul , thank you very much for your support and advice.

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: I glad I could be of some help.  Just remember, you are a good and worthwhile person.  You will come through this.  I believe in you.

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: Hello! How can I help?

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: What is wrong?

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: My job is driving me nuts! I can't handle it anymore.

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: How is it driving you nuts?

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: The pressure has been building and building. They keep giving me more responsibility, but no more help! The pandemic has really made my job a lot harder.

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: I have also went through the same thing as you and I know how hard it feels, so believe in yourself

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: You have been given responsibility because you are competent enough to carry it out

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: I want to quit the job and get away from the pressure. I'm worried about my mental health and also about the risk of COVID.

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: I think that's the problem! I'm TOO competent.

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: Don't quit your job because it will only make life harder in the long run

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: I think the company wouldn't give me so much work if I were worse at my job. The reward for doing a good job is more work!

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: I know, I know! But the anxiety is killing me! Every day at work is worse than the last!

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: Being competent is good and you will surely get compensation for the amount of work you put in, maybe a promotion

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: am not fine

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: What is it that is making you feel this way?

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: i was cheated on severally, and it resulted me to end the relationship

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: It sounds like you had to deal with a partner recently cheating and a breakup, is this right?

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: yes thats it

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: It sounds like this has been stressful for you and you are trying to figure out how to move on from this.

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: exactly, i can tend to focus because i have given so much time and affection, i never thought i would be called the fool after everything i did

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: It is incredibly difficult to get something like this off your mind and it seems like you are trying your best to move forward with your life

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: i want to move on but i dont know how, i tried to but i just cant

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: I have been through this, I learned how to keep myself busy and do things that I enjoy to occupy my mind and let time heal those wounds

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: i think you right, maybe i should renew my netflix sub, since i find great interest in movies so as to get some positive vibes and think less of this whole situation

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: Science shows that during a breakup sometimes you romanticize the relationship and view it as better than it actually was and missing something that wasn't as good as you thought

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: yh thats true

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: My suggestion is to focus on new hobbies, spend time with friends and family when possible, if you have work you can do in the mean time, if you like to exercise or go outside, all of this is a helpful tool.
